tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Thomas Oriti present an engaging mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Bianca Chatfield, Lanard Copeland and Vince Rugari discuss the start of the A-League mens competition, Constellation Cup netball, the Australian womens team at the ODI World Cup, plus NBL and WNBL.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Meet three Australians helping transform lives in New York city jails, online communities and regional NSW using Vedic meditation. Is this ancient practice an answer to contemporary ills?

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Lush Rainforest Garden and Growing Hops
programme.desc: Costa explores a lush rainforest garden, Josh discovers a huge epiphyte collection, Jerry visits a subtropical hops farm, Tammy gets creative with indoor plants, and we meet an artist who has crafted a vibrant sanctuary.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Ex-bricklayer Dave Poppe is determined to build one last house for wife Jan and himself. He has just the spot for it too - one with commanding views from Mt Taranaki in the north to the South Island in the south. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Locked out of Melbournes soaring housing market, Matt and Kate move to Tasmania to build two Earthships with no building experience.

programme.title: Mystery Road: Origin
programme.sub-title: Act Three: Further Down the Rabbit Hole
programme.desc: The dark silent secrets of Loch Iris are slowly rising to the surface. Jay closes in on the suspects. Marys world is torn apart.

programme.title: Death In Brunswick
programme.desc: Down-on-his-luck Carl Fitzgerald falls for Sophie while working as a cook, but things get complicated when he accidentally kills a fellow worker. Now he must turn to his best friend Dave to help him dispose of the body.

programme.title: rage Vault: Tamra Davis
programme.desc: From Lou Reed to Bette Midler, Sonic Youth, Hanson, Ben Lee, Beastie Boys and more, rage lines up the best clips directed by Tamra Davis

programme.title: The Art Of Motherhood
programme.desc: Namila explores how art can help us understand motherhood. Featuring artist Atong Atem, writer and podcaster Elizabeth Day, Kelly-Dawn Hellmrich of Camp Cope, Mother of the House Of Alexander Ella Ganza and Prof. Mary Beard.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A series of death notices in the Oxford Mail, each with a distinctive, cryptic message, provides clues to Endeavours latest - and final - investigation. Meanwhile, Thursday is under pressure from a familiar face. (Final)

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: AFL fanatics John and Rosie have bought an iconic 19th century gasworks building overlooking the North Melbourne Football Club and oval, and they want to turn into their dream home. (Final)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The story of a mother who has never recovered from the moment she knew she would be unable to keep her baby and a daughter who has spent her life longing for the chance to be a part of her mothers life. (Final)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz with a difference, looking at a whole Kit and Kaboodle of K topics. Panellists include Australian comedian Colin Lane.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: The dark world of online sextortion targeting teenage boys on social media. With unprecedented access to police and tech experts, to examine how these networks operate, their motivations, and the true devastation they cause.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump has invited Australias Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to Washington DC for their first one-on-one meeting in person. Chas and John discuss what it all means for trade, AUKUS, defence and US-Australia relations.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Rafael Bonachela, the artistic director of Sydney Dance Company says he was born to dance: but while that love took him to the top of contemporary dance, it splintered his family: now comes the dance to reconcile that.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: The eSafety commissioner, Julie Inman Grant, answers your questions about the upcoming social media ban.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Hot Wheels: Unleashed and Origin Story: Aku Aku And Uka Uka
programme.desc: We speed through the epic tiny toy racing of Hot Wheels: Unleashed, plus we take a look at the Origin Story of Crash Bandicoots mysterious brothers Aku Aku and Uka Uka!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Because of one of Marinettes careless mistakes, one of her closest relatives is akumatized into Qilin, a fearsome supervillain. Will Ladybug dare to fight her?

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Cyborg and Beast Boy face off about burgers and burritos.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When a chicken ends up inside Shauns pillowcase, Shaun tries to get it back, only for the chicken to end up in the farmhouse - and the Farmer to think he is being haunted by a chicken ghost.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: A traveling storytelling troupe Jacob used to be in visits Abbott Elementary.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: Babies at the zoo! Meet adorable bouncy baby goats, a trio of fluffy flamingo chicks, a sweet baby gazelle, and a feisty eland calf at the Wilds.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 Aussie kids, but many say they often feel like their pain is ignored by adults.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand take a look at what happens to your body and why, when you reach puberty. Dr Xand finds out why you sweat more and Dr Chris discovers the real reason teens dont want to get up in the morning.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears become terribly ill and Chole takes it upon herself to take care of them. But things get trickly when word of the Bears sickness goes viral.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its milkshake time in the lab as the Doctors investigate how blood travels around your body - but will their own ideas for brilliant blood vessel machines impress the minis?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is attempting to learn how to ballroom dance using Pidsley as his dancing partner. The din they create annoys the sheep so much that Shaun decides he has to do something to stop them.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Could farts power a rocket? And Gladiator Dynamite tests Dr Dan and Dr Raphs dunking skills in an epic Body Battle!

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: In this show, theres more drama than you can shake a pugil stick at when Comet flies in Hang Tough and Diamond races up the Wall.

programme.title: rage Big Day Out 2002 Special
programme.desc: From The Prodigy to Garbage, System Of A Down, The White Stripes, NOFX, Jurassic 5 and more, rage plays clips from the lineup of the 2002 Big Day Out.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvigs questions on the theme Overseas. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand look at the cool bit of body kit that sucks your tears away when you cry! The Ouchologists quiz the Doctors in todays dose of Ouchology, but who will get snotted?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Its Scoobys dream come true as the gang visits the set of his favourite TV show and he meets the star, his celebrity crush, a dog actress who plays a detective on the screen.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Three baby Monumential turtles hatched and theyre the size of city blocks! The playful babies accidentally sink a fishing trawler! Can the Nektons wrangle these creatures before they sink even more ships?

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Nom Nom must successfully complete anger management.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Beast Boy finds his inner self in a group of bears!

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: When Dracula throws the party of the millennium, Charlie struggles to accept that hes not invited.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Plywood Builder / Cant Beat The Speed Radar
programme.desc: The MythBusters are defying death in the quest for flight and, can we legally beat the police radar?

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Forbidden America
programme.desc: Louis Theroux meets the latest incarnation of the American far right: a political movement born out of the internet and increasingly making its presence felt on the political stage.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: With the hospital air conditioning failing during a heatwave, Dr. Ross treats a six-year-old suffering from a cocaine overdose. Benton and Langworthy try to save a boy shot in self-defense. Susans sister wreaks havoc.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews Bear Grylls
programme.desc: Louis sits down with Bear, in an attempt to understand the real man beneath the tough-guy exterior. He learns about Bear being taken to see self-help gurus as a child and his experience of boarding school.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a snot-tastic dose of Ouchology when the doctors face tough medical questions, and a VIP guest is due in the lab but with a long list of requests, will the Doctors be ready for their arrival?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy takes the Gang to the Minor League Baseball stadium of his youth only to learn that its about to be shut down because a Ghostly Baseball Player is scaring away the fans - and the team!

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Does Dolos really have a lead on finding Ants grandparents? Or is he leading the Nektons into a dangerous chasm between moving tectonic plates for nefarious purposes?

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When the Girls go to Camp, Blossom has a hard time leaving her schoolwork at home.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Batman and Commissioner Gordon go camping, but instead of fun outdoor activities, theyd rather watch TV.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Orla is kicked off the squad when a library book she took out 400 years ago is overdue. The Mobile Unit must use budgeting to turn their $1 into $10 to pay the late fee, or else Orla will not get her badge back.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Ouch Awards is back! We reveal the four winners as the doctors surprise them at home.

programme.title: Dr Anns Secret Lives
programme.desc: Dr Ann Jones joins a team of intrepid scientists on a daring expedition off the Pilbara coast to study one of Australias most mysterious and lethal predators: sea snakes.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Appliances In The Bath / Killer Quicksand / Exploding Tattoo
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie have a MythBuster meltdown, plus they find themselves in over their heads to make killer quicksand and, see what happens when tattoos and technology meet... can body art go boom?

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: Waiter, Theres Confetti in My Magic
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Laurent Piron, Mark Clearview, Glenn West and Abby Segal.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Everybody is enjoying sharing books in the Toy House. Mr Onion reads everybody a book about how his friend Colly Wobble likes to be very silly. Colly Wobble likes the story very much. But what book is Colly Wobble reading?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Time for a game of Spotlight! When Beeps lights make her too easy to find in the dark, Mort switches partners. But winning is no fun without Beep, so he devises a nifty plan to use her radiance to win the game, together.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: All the clutter around Hoopla gives Zap a great idea, he will organise a swap market so everyone can swap stuff they dont need for things they really want.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector finds some litter and wonders what sounds he can make with it.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Ammas creche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig has built a little train and takes Peppa and George for a ride. Along the way they meet their friends and theres room for everyone aboard. Peppa and George think its the best train in the whole world!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmers niece has come to visit, bringing her pet rabbit. When the rabbit disappears Shaun and the Flock are called to action to help track down the illusive pet before the niece discovers its missing.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea swaps Supertatos Tato-Belt with her evil Baddie-Belt which has absurd and baffling functions. Supertato has to work out how to rescue Carrot and Pea with the Baddie-Belt.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: During an aerial vampire move, Isadora takes a tumble and doesnt want to fly anymore.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Monsters At The Museum / The Lost And The Furry One
programme.desc: Frankie learns to share feelings after breaking exhibits at the museum, while Lobo finds lost items with a remembering song. The Super Monsters teach teamwork and the value of friendship.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds join a gymnast to spin hoops, bounce balls, and twirl ribbons! They try cartwheels, leaps, and springs, and follow an elite gymnast on the balance beam. Practice makes perfect!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit: The Tale Of The Rabbit And Squirrel Great Adventure
programme.desc: Peter tells a curious Cotton-tail how he and Squirrel Nutkin became friends and how the squirrel lost his tail. Soon Peter is on an adventure to retrieve Nutkins tail, even though it means going to Owl Island!

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: When rain threatens to spoil a family camping trip, Maddie + Triggs receive a visit from a happy little raindrop, who soon has all the gang up and dancing about the tent.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The Numberblocks build a play fort for the Numberblobs using a series of 3D shapes.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro Pony spends the day just like a real cowboy would have in the Wild West: setting up camp in the garden and sharing stories with his friends.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Ben misses out seeing his favourite comic book artist and a miniature model of the Gauntlet of Doom, Millie and Maya recreate the gauntlet for him.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley needs to do some jobs for the community, but all his vehicles are out of power for some reason. On closer inspection its due to a cloud of butterflies obscuring.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Luna secretly steals Motsukis teleport power. Gekko and Catboy investigate, but mess up with catastrophic results... Can they find it in themselves to put it right?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Kangaroo Beach legend, King Kanga, is back and ready to rule the beach. But the cadets soon learn that he has a very different lifeguardingapproach.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Ruths new car, Cleo, takes to the rails to race Thomas, she soon discovers why she is designed to stick to the roads.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: Teach A Man To Ice Fish Part 1
programme.desc: When the villain, Confetti Betty, strikes the Odd Squad headquarters in the Arctic, the Mobile Unit returns to help Opal and Omars old squad.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie thinks theres a ghost in the house, she and her mom become the Most Magnificent ghost hunters!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: You need only your imagination to have fun in a garden. The kids are assigned a list of garden tasks to receive clues and riddles to get to the next stage. From identifying plants to making compost tea, this is a magical exploration with Hannah.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George meet Kylie Kangaroo and her brother Joey. Peppa shows Kylie how to jump up and down in muddy puddles, but who can jump the highest?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Packing for the pool, Bluey and Dad tease Mum about being so fussy with what to take. But when they arrive underprepared, they realise a little planning goes a long way.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet a sea anemone to see how it feeds underwater. Next they meet a pitcher plant and discover the extraordinary wild connection they share.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, Moon Baby is playing a hiding game with his friends. In Storyland, everybody plays hiding in different places. But who is hiding where?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Pop wakes up with a great idea. Today shell write her very own musical. But as she gets started, Uncle Joe calls her in for breakfast. Then, she must help with heaps of boring jobs. Will Pop get time to write her musical?

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Hoopla is having a dance party and everyone is excited except Ziggy who thinks he is far too clumsy to dance.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Using his duck caller, the Sound Collector sets off to try and find some ducks to talk to.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its a windy day and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop. And he wants to do it all by himself.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are visiting their big cousin Chloe. Today is a special day because Peppa and George are meeting Chloes new baby brother, Alexander for the first time.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer cant believe his luck - he has a winning ticket! He just needs to keep it safe until morning and theres only one dog for the job! Can Bitzer rescue the winning ticket, or has he lost the Farmers fortune?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy offers to look after Miss Pawdry, claiming that shes great with animals. But the cat escapes and ends up in a basket drifting towards the sea!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants fish for dinner, so he goes out fishing with Mr Elf, Ben and Holly on Mr Elfs boat. Mr Elf tells them a story about the biggest, baddest fish ever - Big Bad Barry. The King wants to catch Barry for supper.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The parents are having a clear-out. The good thing is anything they dont want, can go to the charity shop to help others. With their collection of things in a box, they set off to town and visit the Charity Shop.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma talks Big Trev into letting the cadets stay overnight in the submarine for the annual coral spawning, but their dreamy adventure gets derailed when they nearly crash into a sleep-swimming Charlene!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Lobo and the Super Monsters learn that creativity and teamwork can create magic, even without powers.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Rock Band
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay start their own rock band! But Nikhil is deflated when Jay keeps inviting other people to join the band. Nikhil wants it to be just the two of them.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie plays a board game with best friends Nina and Akil, learning how to deal with feelings of impatience, winning and losing.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: How does sound travel? In an episode sprinkled with fun, Michelle creates a Seeing Sound Sprinkle Sensation experiment to discover how sound waves travel.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks celebrate Os birthday with all the fun of the fair. This episode introduces the AIR, URE, ER and EAR letter teams.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George meet Kylie Kangaroo and her brother Joey. Peppa shows Kylie how to jump up and down in muddy puddles, but who can jump the highest?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie thinks theres a ghost in the house, she and her mom become the Most Magnificent ghost hunters!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Little Woo and Seamus call Stanley to help them build a den so they can watch the bugs in the forest without disturbing them.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The story continues after Luna secretly stole Motsukis teleport power. Gekko and Catboy investigate, but mess up with catastrophic results... Can they find it in themselves to put it right?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma talks Big Trev into letting the cadets stay overnight in the submarine for the annual coral spawning, but their dreamy adventure gets derailed when they nearly crash into a sleep-swimming Charlene!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is asked to help at the animal park for the day and realises theres more to the job than he first thought.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners make an arty leaf mobile for their balcony using fallen leaves theyve collected.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come along on a fun-filled food adventure with The Wiggles! Dance along to classics like Hot Potato and Fruit Salad and sing along with a new favourite Marshmallow for a delicious episode of Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankies bad day worsens at the museum, but his friends teach him the value of teamwork, honesty, and leaning on others when things go wrong.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: To celebrate Freddy Foxs birthday the children go on a trip to a Dinosaur Park. With Grampy Rabbit as their leader, they follow dinosaur footprints to find Freddys birthday treat.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy wants to prove himself a fast driver so powers his cat racer with a moon crystal and blasts into space.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Theres an ice rink in the Park and Mr. Gruber teaches Paddington how to skate for the ice disco but will be brave the ice himself again after a past fall?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Springtime in the Little Kingdom brings out tulips, daffodils, hedgehogs...and two very hungry gnomes. Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf come up with a plan to stop the gnomes from eating everything in sight.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Normally Mission Command-bound, Jennie is super-excited to travel in Star Bird-1 to observe a pod of the Space Whales but isnt thrilled when the Rocket Club keep scaring off the whales.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Thomas Oriti present an engaging mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.desc: Donald Trump has invited Australias Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to Washington DC for their first one-on-one meeting in person. Chas and John discuss what it all means for trade, AUKUS, defence and US-Australia relations.

programme.desc: Rafael Bonachela, the artistic director of Sydney Dance Company says he was born to dance: but while that love took him to the top of contemporary dance, it splintered his family: now comes the dance to reconcile that.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: A routine defence training exercise ends in tragedy near Townsville, remote residents paying thousands of dollars for groceries just to survive, plus from the bush to the big time - could our next Matilda be from Borroloola?

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong with the news from Asia: Dozens killed in clashes between Afghanistan and Pakistan, a deadly factory fire breaks out in Bangladesh, plus we meet the people keeping a Japanese subculture of decorated trucks alive.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Israel and Hamas trade blame over ceasefire violations: Can Trumps truce hold the peace? Plus the media mass walkout at the Pentagon, the scandal engulfing Democrats in Virginia and a look at Reagans Star Wars program.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.desc: Donald Trump grabs headlines despite not winning the Nobel Peace Prize. Maria Corina Machado wins, Gaza erupts, and the Boyer Lectures spotlight Australias democracy. Plus dogs with attitude and clever cuttlefish.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: A routine defence training exercise ends in tragedy near Townsville, remote residents paying thousands of dollars for groceries just to survive, plus from the bush to the big time - could our next Matilda be from Borroloola?

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers joins Laura Tingle, Peter Hartcher and Karen Middleton to preview PM Albaneses meeting with Trump about AUKUS, defence spending, trade and critical minerals, precarious Gaza ceasefire and superannuation reform.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: A November rate cut back on the table as the jobless rate surges to a near four year high. Plus angry Qantas customers caught in the cyber hack scandal calling for greater penalties. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.desc: Promoting Australian grown cut flowers in a market dominated by imports; Warnings a much deadlier strain of avian influenza could arrive this spring; and the world record-breaking heavy horses showcasing agricultural history.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: In Ukraine, it is becoming increasingly difficult to care for the wounded on the frontlines. Plus 90 Italian inmates live on the prison island of Gorgona, so what are their lives like in the middle of the sea?

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: We look at whats behind South Australias algal bloom outbreak, whats being done to fix it, and how future outbreaks can be prevented.

programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Johnson Raela presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump has invited Australias Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to Washington DC for their first one-on-one meeting in person. Chas and John discuss what it all means for trade, AUKUS, defence and US-Australia relations.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
